title: ICE with `#[derive(Default)]` on enum with repeated variant names

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Found with a [modified fuzz-rustc](https://github.com/jruderman/fuzz-rustc)

### Code

```rust
#[derive(Default)]
enum E {
    #[default] A,
    #[default] A,
}
```

### Error output

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !suggestion.is_empty()', [compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic.rs:628](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/1eb62b1235fd77200e6bd967d70e83c0f2497233/compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic.rs#L628)

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.67.0-nightly (1eb62b123 2022-11-27) running on x86_64-apple-darwin
```

</details>

### Regression

First ICEd in nightly-2021-07-29, likely from #86735 (@jhpratt), which added `#[derive(Default)]` support for enums.

### Version

```
rustc 1.67.0-nightly (1eb62b123 2022-11-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 1eb62b1235fd77200e6bd967d70e83c0f2497233
commit-date: 2022-11-27
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.67.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.4
```
